acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=14mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,179mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 1999)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification, though NTP TR491 (2000) presents toxicity data and the substance is classified as Category R by NTP (2005).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 89% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=3.03 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on May 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Stable to air, heat and light (HSDB, 2006); not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Slightly irritating."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Slightly irritating."

skin_sensitizer.rationale: According to the description in HSDB (2002) of human health effects, a Maximization test showed no indication of sensitization in humans. However, classification is not possible, with only one set of data showing "negative" available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (liver, stomach, blood system, adrenal gland, submandibular gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, stomach, blood system, adrenal gland, submandibular gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "hepatocellular hypertrophy, oval cell hyperplasia, bile duct hyperplasia (females), cystic degeneration, neuroendocrine cell hyperplasia and atrophy of the glandular stomach," "increased platelet counts; increased serum activities of alanine aminotransferase and sorbitol dehydrogenase indicative of hepatocellular lesions; increased incidences of adrenal gland cortical hypertrophy and/or cytoplasmic alteration in the submandibular gland occurred," "the incidences of lesions of the glandular stomach were increased" (NTP TR491 (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
